The 'Ocellaris Clownfish', ' Clownfish' or 'False Percula Clownfish' (Amphiprion
ocellaris) is a popular aquarium fish. It is very closely related to A. percula,
the Orange Clownfish or "True Percula Clownfish", and often lives in association
with the sea anemone [[Heteractis magnifica]], using them for shelter and
protection. Generally, Ocellaris clownfish are hardier, and slightly less
aggressive than its Percula counterpart. Both species are found in coral reefs
of the Indo-Pacific, particularly in the Fiji and Tonga regions.
